pullRequest.title: PR #3 for User Context Implementation - EditingDomain adjustments
pullRequest.bodyText:
This is the PR changing the TransactionalEditingDomain related code for the multi user capabilities. Make sure that PR #571 and #576 with all data model related changes is merged first.
This PR includes:

Including the user context into transactional editing domain.
Added method to CommandStack for finally executing a command in the user context.
Fixed minor issues with taking the workspace lock usign the transactional editing domain (e.g. also in the DiagramHelper).
Added test cases for the changes.
Introduced new TestBuilder and Nature to detect invocations of the builder. Using the builders from virsat.build is not possible due to cyclic dependencies when executing with tycho/maven.
Fixed some strange coverage issues on the DiagramHelper, likely a consequence of the changes there.

⚠️ Atention ! Had to also work on the CodeCoverage of the graphiti plguin, i.e. the DiagramHelper. ⚠️
This PR finally closes #548.

commit.message:
Refactoring User Rights Management - (Task #548)

- Added new Interface for UserContext to UserRegistry
- Changed RightsHelper to make use of UserContext
- Added UserContext to TransactionalEditingDomain
- Adjusted TransactionalBuilders to make user of UserContext
- Adjusted Equation and InheritanceBuilder to make use of UserContext

---
Task #548: Introduce capabilities to override current user for command
executions

Fixed all code in test cases - (Task #548)

- Added new method to rights helper for checking writeAccess for
SIngleUser use cases

---
Task #548: Introduce capabilities to override current user for command
executions

Updated Model to use modified RMCheckCommand - (Task #548)

- Updated model.edit template
- run generation of model.edit
- Updated VirSatResourceSet to use Use Context
- Updated Transactional Editing Domain to use User Context
- Updated all relevant dependencies
- Fixed test cases

---
Task #548: Introduce capabilities to override current user for command
executions

Cleaning Up test cases - (Task #548)

- Cleaned Up Equation Builder test cases
- Added new test cases for VirSatEditingDomainRegistry

---
Task #548: Introduce capabilities to override current user for command
executions

Updated Assign Discipline Command - (Task #548)

- Refactored Code
- Improved test cases

---
Task #548: Introduce capabilities to override current user for command
executions

Added IUserContext to TED - (Task #548)

- Added user context to ted.
- Added override capabilities.
- Added mechanism to execute command in workspace of TED under different
user.
- Enhanced capabilities of Atomic Exception Throwing.

---
Task #548: Introduce capabilities to override current user for command
executions

Adjusting Command Stack for User Context - (Task #548)

- Refactored Command Stack to execute everything in one workspace
operation modified by a user context.

---
Task #548: Introduce capabilities to override current user for command
executions

Merge remote-tracking branch
'origin/feature/task_548-User_Context_Model_Adjustment' into
feature/task_548-User_Context_Implementation

nodes.bodyText: setup and teardown can be removed
Maybe put the variables before the constructor?

Does it make sense to execute the builder if the command was not executeable or there was an exception?
I think this might make it harder to reproduce issues, say, if there is a problem with some command since the builder will change the state of the model.

commit.message:
Changes due to review - (Task #548)

- removed empty setup and tearDown method from test cases
- fixed call to builder in Command Stack to only execute on successful
commands.
- Moved variable declaration in class.

---
Task #548: Introduce capabilities to override current user for command
executions

Removing old git merge statement - (Task #548)

- Merge block was still in comment of method.

---
Task #548: Introduce capabilities to override current user for command
executions
